abstract.p: Group of 65 swimmers swims across Hudson River, raising close to $25,000 in pledges for Southern New York chapter of National Multiple Sclerosis Society (S)

block.p: Swimming across the Hudson River, 65 people -- from 10 to 60 -- raised close to $25,000 in pledges for the Southern New York chapter of the National Multiple Sclerosis Society. The swimmers were accompanied by 55 kayakers, eight support powerboats, members of the Coast Guard, three diving teams and rescue teams from the Irvington Fire Department and the Croton-on-Hudson Police Department, said Sgt. Dennis Chillemi of the Irvington police. The swimmers included Leslie Erskine, a Somers resident who suffers from multiple sclerosis; Jean Pierre Koenig, an amputee from Greensboro, N.C.; and Dennis Cahill, commissioner of the state Department of Environmental Conservation.

Swimming across the Hudson River, 65 people -- from 10 to 60 -- raised close to $25,000 in pledges for the Southern New York chapter of the National Multiple Sclerosis Society. The swimmers were accompanied by 55 kayakers, eight support powerboats, members of the Coast Guard, three diving teams and rescue teams from the Irvington Fire Department and the Croton-on-Hudson Police Department, said Sgt. Dennis Chillemi of the Irvington police. The swimmers included Leslie Erskine, a Somers resident who suffers from multiple sclerosis; Jean Pierre Koenig, an amputee from Greensboro, N.C.; and Dennis Cahill, commissioner of the state Department of Environmental Conservation.
